  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="386" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:289.65pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Destinations</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="386" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:289.65pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Small Cities</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">29</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">47</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">40</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='40',FILE='C:\fc\89191412528_H0015A_1948183\9193-1-dm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 19:15 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our Fiscal Year.</font></i></font><i>&nbsp;&nbsp; </i>We operate on a calendar year ending
on the last day in December. For convenience, we refer to the fiscal years
ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, December&nbsp;31, 2005 and December&nbsp;31, 2004
as 2006, 2005 and 2004, respectively.</p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our Operating
Revenue<a name="OurOperatingRevenue_153652"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our operating
revenue comprises both air travel on a stand-alone basis and bundled with
hotels, rental cars and other travel-related services. We believe our
diversified revenue streams distinguish us from other U.S. airlines and other
travel companies.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>Scheduled service revenues.&nbsp;&nbsp; </i>Scheduled
service revenues consist of nonstop flights between our leisure destinations
and small cities.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>Fixed fee contract revenues.&nbsp;&nbsp; </i>Our
fixed fee contract revenues consist largely of agreements with affiliates of
Harrah&#146;s Entertainment&nbsp;Inc. and Apple Vacations West,&nbsp;Inc. that
provide for a predictable revenue stream. We also provide charter service on a
seasonal and ad hoc basis to Harrah&#146;s, Apple and others.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>Ancillary revenues.&nbsp;&nbsp; </i>Our ancillary
revenues are generated from the sale of hotel rooms, rental cars, advance seat
assignments, in-flight products and other items sold in conjunction with our
scheduled air service. We recognize our ancillary revenues net of amounts paid
to wholesale providers, travel agent commissions and credit card processing fees.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Seasonality.</font></i></font><i>&nbsp;&nbsp; </i>Our business is seasonal in nature
with traffic demand historically being lowest in the third quarter and highest
in the first quarter. Our operating revenue is largely driven by perceived
product value, advertising and promotional activities and can be adversely
impacted during periods with reduced discretionary leisure travel spending,
such as the back-to-school season.</p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our Operating
Expenses<a name="OurOperatingExpenses_153700"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A brief description of the items included in our
operating expense line items follows. Our cost structure is highly variable as
we consider our fixed costs to have represented only 3.83&#162; of our cost per
available seat mile (&#147;CASM&#148;) in 2006, or 49.8% of our 2006 operating expenses.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft
fuel expense.</font></i></font><i>&nbsp;&nbsp; </i>Aircraft
fuel expense includes the cost of aircraft fuel, fuel taxes, into plane fees
and airport fuel flowage, storage or through-put fees. Under certain of our
fixed fee flying agreements, we are reimbursed by our customers if fuel exceeds
a pre-determined cost per gallon, and these reimbursements are netted against
fuel expense.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Salary
and benefits expense.</font></i></font><i>&nbsp;&nbsp; </i>Salary
and benefits expense includes wages and salaries as well as expenses associated
with employee benefit plans and employer payroll taxes.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Station
operations expense.</font></i></font><i>&nbsp;&nbsp; </i>Station
operations expense includes the fees charged by airports for the use or lease
of airport facilities and fees charged by third party vendors for ground
handling services and commissary expenses.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Maintenance
and repairs expense.</font></i></font><i>&nbsp;&nbsp; </i>Maintenance
and repairs expense includes all parts, materials and spares required to
maintain our aircraft. Also included are fees for repairs performed by third
party vendors.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sales
and marketing expense.</font></i></font><i>&nbsp;&nbsp; </i>Sales
and marketing expense includes all advertising, promotional expenses, travel
agent commissions, and credit card discount fees associated with sale of
scheduled service.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft
lease rentals expense.</font></i></font><i>&nbsp;&nbsp; </i>Aircraft
lease rentals expense consists of the cost of leasing aircraft which are
operated under operating leases with third parties.</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">41</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='41',FILE='C:\fc\89191412528_H0015A_1948183\9193-1-dm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 19:15 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Depreciation
and amortization expense.</font></i></font><i>&nbsp;&nbsp; </i>This expense includes the depreciation of all fixed
assets, including aircraft that we own, and amortization on aircraft that we
operate under capital leases.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other expense.</font></i></font><i>&nbsp;&nbsp; </i>Other expense includes the cost of
passenger liability insurance, aircraft hull insurance, and all other insurance
policies except for employee welfare insurance. Additionally, this expense
includes travel and training expenses for crews and ground personnel, facility
lease expenses, professional fees, personal property taxes and all other
administrative and operational overhead expenses not included in other line
items above.</p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Trends and
Uncertainties Affecting Our Business<a name="TrendsAndUncertaintiesAffectingOu_153708"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We believe our financial
success is driven by variable factors that affect airlines and their markets,
and by trends affecting the travel industry. The following discussion describes
certain key factors we believe may affect our future performance.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Demographics and Consumer Behavior</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The airline industry is
influenced by lifestyle and demographic trends, and the performance of the
broader U.S. economy. We believe the current demographic and lifestyle trends
are positive drivers of the leisure travel industry. The aging of the baby
boomers as they enter their peak earning years with more disposable income, and
the recent economic expansion have both had a positive impact on growing
consumer demand for leisure travel.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft Fuel</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The airline industry is
heavily dependent on the use of jet fuel and fuel costs represent a significant
portion of the total operating expenses for airlines. Fuel costs have been
subject to wide price fluctuations. Fuel availability is also subject to
periods of market surplus and shortage and is affected by demand for heating
oil, gasoline and other petroleum products. The cost and future availability of
fuel cannot be predicted with any degree of certainty.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Labor</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The airline industry is
heavily unionized and the wages and benefits of unionized airline industry
employees are determined by collective bargaining agreements. Conflicts between
unionized airlines and their unions can lead to work slowdowns or stoppages. We
currently have a non-unionized work force and are not subject to collective
bargaining agreements at the present time. If our employees were to unionize in
the future and we were unable to reach agreement on the terms of their
collective bargaining agreement, or we were to experience wide-spread employee
dissatisfaction, we could be subject to work slowdowns or stoppages. In
addition, we may be subject to disruption by organized labor groups protesting
our non-union status. Any of these events could have an adverse effect on
our future results. Our flight attendants rejected union representation in an
election that finished December&nbsp;4, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Competition</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The airline industry is
highly competitive. Passenger demand and fare levels have historically been
influenced by, among other things, industry capacity and pricing actions taken
by other airlines. The principal competitive factors in the airline industry
are fare pricing, customer service, routes served, flight schedules, types of
aircraft, safety record and reputation, code-sharing relationships, and
frequent flyer programs.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">42</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='42',FILE='C:\fc\89191412528_H0015A_1948183\9193-1-dm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 19:15 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">RESULTS OF
OPERATIONS<a name="ResultsOfOperations_153718"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
table below presents our operating expenses as a percentage of operating
revenue for the last three fiscal years.</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="352" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:263.75pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="32" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">2006</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="32" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">2005</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="32" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">2004</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.2pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="352" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:263.75pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating revenue</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="32" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">100.0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="32" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">100.0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>

  <td width="14" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.2pt;">

 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="352" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:263.75pt;">

  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">

  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">

  <td width="32" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9.3</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.2pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="352" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:263.75pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Total operating expense</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="32" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">90.7</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">%</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="32" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">93.6</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">%</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="32" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">93.3</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:10.2pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">%</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2006 Compared to
2005<a name="a2006ComparedTo2005_153808"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Summary<a name="Summary_153809"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We recorded total operating revenue of $243.4&nbsp;million,
income from operations of $22.6&nbsp;million and net income of
$8.7&nbsp;million for 2006. By comparison, in 2005, we recorded total operating
revenue of $132.5&nbsp;million, income from operations of $8.5&nbsp;million and
net income of $7.3&nbsp;million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31, 2006, we had a fleet of 26
aircraft with 24 in service compared with a fleet of 22 aircraft with 17 in
service as of December&nbsp;31, 2005. The growth of our fleet enabled a 71.5%
increase in available seat miles (&#147;ASMs&#148;) for 2006 compared to 2005 as
departures increased by 72.4% and average stage length decreased by 1.1%.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Substantially all of our
ASM growth in 2006 compared to 2005 was in scheduled service which represented
86.2% of total ASMs&nbsp;in 2006 compared to 77.3% in 2005. Fixed fee contract
flying ASMs&nbsp;increased by 4.3%, and scheduled service ASMs&nbsp;increased
by 91.2%.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating Revenue<a name="OperatingRevenue_153811"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our operating revenue
increased 83.7%, or $110.9&nbsp;million, to $243.4&nbsp;million in 2006 from
$132.5&nbsp;million in 2005. This was driven by a 73.8% increase in revenue
passenger miles (&#147;RPMs&#148;) and a 7.2% increase in revenue per ASM (&#147;RASM&#148;).</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Scheduled service
revenues:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Scheduled service revenues
increased 96.7%, or $87.7&nbsp;million, to $178.3&nbsp;million in 2006 from
$90.7&nbsp;million in 2005 due to a 93.9% increase in scheduled service RPMs.&nbsp;Yield
increased 1.4% in 2006 versus 2005 due to a 3.7% shorter scheduled stage length
and the dilutive effect of introductory pricing on 11 new routes to Las Vegas,
nine new routes to Orlando and 12 new routes to Tampa/St. Petersburg started
during 2006. The decrease in average stage length coupled with an increase in
load factor of 1.1&nbsp;percentage points resulted in a 2.9% increase in
scheduled service RASM from 7.01&#162; to 7.21&#162;.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fixed fee contract
revenues:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fixed fee contract
revenues increased 10.1%, or $3.1&nbsp;million, to $33.7&nbsp;million in 2006
up from $30.6&nbsp;million in 2005. Revenues increased because of a new
short-term contract running from May&nbsp;through </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">43</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='43',FILE='C:\fc\89191412528_H0015A_1948183\9193-1-dm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 19:15 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">August&nbsp;2006.
We have agreed with Harrah&#146;s Laughlin to increase our fixed fee flying
beginning in January&nbsp;2007. We expect this will produce incremental fixed
fee flying revenue in 2007.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Ancillary revenues:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Ancillary revenues
increased 179.2% to $31.3&nbsp;million in 2006 up from $11.2&nbsp;million in
2005. The increase in ancillary revenue was due to a 100.2% increase in
scheduled service passengers and a 39.5% increase in ancillary revenue per
passenger from $11.55 to $16.11 due primarily to the sale of several new
products.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating Expenses<a name="OperatingExpenses_153820"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our operating expenses increased by 78.1%, or
$96.8&nbsp;million, to $220.8&nbsp;million in 2006 up from $124.0&nbsp;million
during the same period in 2005. Our financial results for 2006 were
significantly impacted by the dramatic increase in the price of aircraft fuel
over the prior year.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
general, our operating expenses are significantly affected by changes in our
capacity, as measured by ASMs.&nbsp;The following table presents our unit
costs, defined as operating expense per ASM, for the indicated periods.</font></p>

<div align="center">

  <td width="368" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:275.95pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Station

  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">

  <td width="368" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:275.95pt;">

  per ASM (&#147;CASM&#148;)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7.69</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#162;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7.41</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#162;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="30" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:22.85pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.8</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="19" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:14.05pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="368" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:275.95pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating CASM,
  excluding fuel</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.15</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#162;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.27</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#162;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="30" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:22.85pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2.8</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="19" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:14.05pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft
fuel expense.</font></i></font><i>&nbsp;&nbsp; </i>Aircraft
fuel expense increased 93.2%, or $49.0&nbsp;million, to $101.6&nbsp;million in
2006 up from $52.6&nbsp;million in 2005. This change was due to a 70.3%
increase in gallons consumed and a 13.4% increase in the average cost per
gallon to $2.12 per gallon during 2006 compared to $1.87 in 2005.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Salary
and benefits expense.</font></i></font><i>&nbsp;&nbsp; </i>Salary
and benefits expense increased 60.9%, or $13.2&nbsp;million, to $35.0&nbsp;million
in 2006 up from $21.7&nbsp;million in 2005. This increase is largely
attributable to a 41.9% increase in full-time equivalent employees to support
our growth. We employed approximately 846 full-time equivalent employees as of December&nbsp;31,
2006, compared to 596 full-time equivalent employees as of December&nbsp;31,
2005.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Station
operations expense.</font></i></font><i>&nbsp;&nbsp; </i>Station
operations expense increased 76.5%, or $10.8&nbsp;million, to $24.9&nbsp;million
in 2006 compared to $14.1&nbsp;million in 2005. The increase in station
operations expense exceeded the 72.4% increase in departures contributing to an
increase of 3.6% in station operation expenses on a CASM basis. The increase in
unit station operations expense was driven by a large number of new station
openings, particularly in the fourth quarter of 2006, which outweighed an
increase in the proportion of scheduled flying, which generally has a lower
station operations expense per departure relative to fixed fee flying.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Maintenance
and repairs expense.</font></i></font><i>&nbsp;&nbsp; </i>Maintenance
and repairs expense increased by 115.9%, or $10.5&nbsp;million, to
$19.5&nbsp;million in 2006 up from $9.0&nbsp;million in 2005. Maintenance and
repairs CASM </p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">44</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='44',FILE='C:\fc\89191412528_H0015A_1948183\9193-1-dm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 19:15 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">increased 25.9% as
increased maintenance expense outpaced the increase in aircraft utilization.
The increase in maintenance and repairs expense is largely attributed to heavy
maintenance checks on 14 aircraft during 2006 versus four heavy checks during
2005 and the substantially larger fleet as of December&nbsp;31, 2006 when
compared to 2005. Additionally, in 2006 we had a significant increase in the
number of heavy engine overhauls over 2005 due to a significant year-over-year
increase in the number of unplanned maintenance as a result of engine foreign
object damage.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sales
and marketing expense.</font></i></font><i>&nbsp;&nbsp; </i>Sales
and marketing expense increased 65.2%, or $3.7&nbsp;million, to
$9.3&nbsp;million in 2006 compared to $5.6&nbsp;million in 2005. On a CASM
basis, sales and marketing expense declined 5.9% primarily due to the
elimination of travel agency commissions for air only sales, a decrease in
credit card processing fees and an increase in the percentage of sales through
our website, our lowest cost distribution channel.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft
lease rentals expense.</font></i></font><i>&nbsp;&nbsp; </i>Aircraft
lease rentals expense increased by 2.3%, or $0.1&nbsp;million, to
$5.1&nbsp;million in 2006 up from $5.0&nbsp;million in 2005. On a CASM basis,
aircraft lease rentals expense decreased 40.0% to 0.18&#162; in 2006 down from 0.30&#162;
in 2005 due to an increase in the percentage of owned versus leased aircraft
and the benefits of higher aircraft utilization. In 2006, average block hours
for aircraft in service increased 9.7%, or 18&nbsp;hours, to 202.7&nbsp;hours
per month compared to 184.7&nbsp;hours in 2005.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Depreciation
and amortization expense.</font></i></font><i>&nbsp;&nbsp; </i>Depreciation and amortization expense was
$10.6&nbsp;million in 2006 compared to $5.1&nbsp;million in 2005, an increase
of 108.0% as the number of in-service aircraft owned or subject to capital
leases increased from nine as of December&nbsp;31, 2005 to 22 as of December&nbsp;31,
2006.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other expense.</font></i></font><i>&nbsp;&nbsp; </i>Other expense increased by 37.2% to
$15.0&nbsp;million in 2006 compared to $10.9&nbsp;million in 2005 due mainly to
increased aviation insurance, administrative, facilities and training expenses
associated with our company&#146;s growth.</p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other (Income)
Expense<a name="OtherincomeExpense_154058"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other income increased from $1.2 million in 2005 to
$6.7&nbsp;million in 2006. This change is attributable to three factors: (1)&nbsp;a
change in net gain on fuel derivatives from a gain of $0.6&nbsp;million in 2005
to a loss of $4.2&nbsp;million in 2006, (2)&nbsp;an increase in interest
expense from $3.0&nbsp;million in 2005 to $5.5&nbsp;million in 2006 relating to
interest on aircraft purchased and acquired under capital leases during the
period and (3)&nbsp;an increase in interest income from $1.2&nbsp;million in
2005 to $3.0&nbsp;million in 2006 as a result of increased cash and short-term
investment balances.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our fuel derivative
contracts do not qualify for hedge accounting under Statement of Financial
Standards No.&nbsp;133, <i>Accounting for
Derivative Instruments and Hedging Activities</i>. Therefore, we
recognize changes in the fair value of our derivatives when they occur, as a
component of other (income) expense. We recognize gain or loss from a
mark-to-market adjustment at the end of each period, which estimates as of that
date the future value of open contracts which will settle in subsequent
periods. Gain or loss is also recognized as contracts settle and the amount can
vary depending on the market value of fuel at that time. We recognized a
$2.4&nbsp;million loss in 2005 on the mark-to-market adjustment for our open
fuel derivative contracts and we recognized $3.0&nbsp;million in net gains for
contracts settled in 2005. By contrast, we recognized a $1.6&nbsp;million loss
in 2006 on the mark-to-market adjustment for our open fuel derivative contracts
and we recognized $2.6&nbsp;million in net losses for contracts settled in
2006. The change from an overall gain on fuel derivatives to a loss from 2005
to 2006 is due to the fact that fuel prices predominantly increased during 2005
and decreased during the second half of 2006, along with an increase in the
amounts hedged over time due to the growth of the company.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">45</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='45',FILE='C:\fc\89191412528_H0015A_1948183\9193-1-dm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 19:15 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Income Tax Expense<a name="IncomeTaxExpense_154100"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For all of 2005 and all
but the last 18 days of 2006 we operated as a limited liability company or
subchapter S&nbsp;corporation. Under these structures, we did not pay federal
corporate income tax for these periods. Instead, the members of the limited
liability company or stockholders of the subchapter S&nbsp;corporation were
liable for income tax on the taxable income as it affected their individual
income tax returns. Accordingly, our income tax provision in 2005 reflects
state taxes owed by us in certain states in which we operate. For the last 18
days of 2006, we operated as a subchapter C corporation, and we expect to
operate as a subchapter C corporation for the foreseeable future. The income
tax expense for 2006 was impacted by a $6.4 million charge to recognize
deferred tax liabilities due to the tax reorganization carried out in
connection with our initial public offering.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2005 Compared to
2004<a name="a2005ComparedTo2004_154102"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Summary<a name="Summary_154102"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We recorded total operating revenue of
$132.5&nbsp;million, income from operations of $8.5&nbsp;million and net income
of $7.3&nbsp;million for 2005. By comparison, in 2004, we recorded total
operating revenue of $90.4&nbsp;million, income from operations of
$6.1&nbsp;million and net income of $9.1&nbsp;million. Net income decreased
despite a 39.9% increase in operating income principally as a result of a lower
amount of non-cash gain on fuel derivatives.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2005, we added 12 aircraft to our fleet, eight
of which were placed into service, bringing the total number of aircraft in the
fleet to 22 and the total number of aircraft in service to 17. Four of these
aircraft were introduced into service in early 2006. The growth in our fleet
generated an increase of 3,277 departures, or 39.2%, and an increase of
455.8&nbsp;million ASMs, or 37.4% in 2005 compared to 2004. Average stage
length increased by 3.1% from 948 to 977 miles in 2005. ASM growth trailed the
growth in departures despite the increase in stage length due to the
reconfiguration of our MD83 fleet in late 2004, which reduced the number of
seats from 162 to 150.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our mix of business
changed in 2005. Scheduled service ASMs&nbsp;increased 86.2% and represented
77.3% of total ASMs in 2005 versus 57.0% in 2004. This change was due to both
to an increase in scheduled service flying and a decrease in certain fixed fee
flying.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating Revenue<a name="OperatingRevenue_154104"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our operating revenue for
2005 increased $42.1&nbsp;million or 46.6% compared to 2004. This was driven by
a 41.6% increase in RPMs and an increase in RASM of 6.6% largely due to a
2.3&nbsp;percentage point improvement in load factor.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Schedule service
revenues:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Scheduled service revenues
increased 96.1% in 2005 compared to 2004, driven by a 99.0% increase in
RPMs&nbsp;and an increase in ASMs&nbsp;of 86.2% as we added aircraft and
scheduled service to Orlando and more small cities. Yield was down 1.5% in 2005
versus 2004 while average stage length increased 14.5%. Load factor increased
by 5.2&nbsp;percentage points and scheduled service RASM increased by 5.4%.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fixed fee contract
revenues:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fixed fee contract
revenues represented 23.1% of total revenue, or $30.6&nbsp;million in 2005, a
25.2&nbsp;percentage point decrease from 2004 in which we had
$41.0&nbsp;million of fixed fee contract revenues. This decrease results from
reduced flight hours associated with our fixed fee flying agreements as we
operated two major programs for Apple Vacations West in 2004, but only one in
2005.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">46</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='46',FILE='C:\fc\89191412528_H0015A_1948183\9193-1-dm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 30 19:15 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Ancillary revenues:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Ancillary revenues
increased 256.3% to $11.2&nbsp;million for 2005 compared to $3.1&nbsp;million
for 2004. The increase in ancillary revenue was due to an 81.0% increase in
scheduled service passengers and a 96.8% increase in ancillary revenue per
passenger from $5.87 to $11.55 due primarily to the sale of several new
products.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating Expenses<a name="OperatingExpenses_154110"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our operating expenses for
2005 increased $39.7&nbsp;million or 47.1% compared to 2004. During 2005, our
financial results were significantly impacted by the dramatic increase in the
price of aircraft fuel.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
general, our operating expenses are significantly affected by changes in our
capacity, as measured by ASMs.&nbsp;The following table presents our unit
costs, defined as operating expense per ASM, for the indicated periods:</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="368" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:275.75pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="103" colspan="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:77.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Year Ended<br>
  December&nbsp;31,</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="53" colspan="3" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:39.9pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Percentage</font></b></p>
  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="368" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:275.75pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft lease
  rentals</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.30</font></p>

  <td width="10" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.25pt;">
