  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="39" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:29.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">32,066</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has classified
investments as short-term since it maintains a liquid portfolio of investments
that are available for current operations.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Expendable Parts, Supplies and Fuel</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Expendable parts, supplies
and fuel inventories are valued at cost using the first-in, first-out method.
An allowance for obsolescence has been recorded based upon historical results
and management&#146;s expectations of future operations. Such inventories are
charged to expense as they are used in operations.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Property and Equipment</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Property
and equipment are recorded at cost and depreciated using the straight-line
method to their estimated residual values over their estimated useful lives as
follows:</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="424" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:318.2pt;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="62" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:46.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10 years</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="424" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:318.2pt;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Flight Equipment</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="62" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:46.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5-7 years</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="424" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:318.2pt;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Equipment and leasehold improvements</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="62" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:46.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5-7 years</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft and jet engines have an estimated average
residual value of 18% of original cost; other categories of property and
equipment are assumed to have no residual value.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft under capital
lease arrangements are depreciated over the shorter of the useful life of the
aircraft or remaining lease term.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">64</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='64',FILE='C:\fc\9212173371_D11896_1955427\9193-1-fm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:18 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:16.0pt;margin:0in 0in 24.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ALLEGIANT TRAVEL COMPANY<br> NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)<br> For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005 and 2004<br> (Dollars in thousands except share and per share amounts)</font></b></p>


<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Summary of Significant
Accounting Policies (Continued)</p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Capitalized
Interest</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest attributable to
funds used to finance the refurbishment of aircraft prior to revenue service is
capitalized as an additional cost of the related asset provided the refurbishment
is extensive or requires an extended period of time to complete, generally
longer than 90 days. Interest is capitalized at the Company&#146;s average interest
rate on long-term debt. Capitalization of interest ceases when the asset is
ready for service. For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005 and 2004,
the Company incurred interest expense of $5,517, $3,009 and $1,399,
respectively, net of capitalized interest of $31, $59 and $0 in 2006, 2005 and
2004, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Measurement of Impairment of Long-Lived Assets</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company records
impairment losses on long-lived assets used in operations, consisting
principally of property and equipment, when events or changes in circumstances
indicate, in management&#146;s judgment, that the assets might be impaired and the
undiscounted cash flows estimated to be generated by those assets are less than
the carrying amount of those assets. Cash flow estimates are based on
historical results adjusted to reflect the Company&#146;s best estimate of future
market and operating conditions. The net carrying value of assets not
recoverable is reduced to fair value if lower than carrying value. Estimates of
fair value represent the Company&#146;s best estimate based on industry trends and
reference to market rates and transactions and are subject to change.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Revenue Recognition</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Scheduled service revenues consist of passenger
revenue involving limited frequency nonstop flights between Las Vegas, Nevada,
Orlando, Florida and Tampa/St Petersburg, Florida and 47 small cities as of December&nbsp;31,
2006 and is recognized when the travel-related service or transportation is
provided or when the ticket expires unused. Nonrefundable tickets expire on the
date of the intended flight, unless the date is extended by notification from
the customer in advance of the intended flight. Tickets sold, but not yet used,
as well as unexpired credits, are included in air traffic liability.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fixed fee contract revenues consist largely of long
term agreements to provide charter service on a seasonal and ad hoc basis to
affiliates of Harrah&#146;s Entertainment Inc., Apple Vacations West,&nbsp;Inc. and
others. Fixed fee contract revenues are recognized when the transportation is
provided. Under certain of the Company&#146;s fixed fee contracts, if fuel exceeds a
predetermined cost per gallon, reimbursements are received from the customer
and netted against fuel expense.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Ancillary revenues are
generated from the sale of hotel rooms, rental cars, advance seat assignments,
in-flight products and other items. Revenues from the sale of hotel rooms and
rental cars are recognized at the time the room is occupied or rental car
utilized. The amount of revenues attributed to each element of a bundled sale
involving hotel rooms and rental cars in addition to airfare is determined in
accordance with Emerging Issues Task Force (&#147;EITF&#148;) No.&nbsp;00-21, <i>Revenue Arrangements with Multiple Deliverables</i>.
The sale of hotel rooms, rental cars and other ancillary products are recorded
net of amounts paid to wholesale providers, travel agent commissions and credit
card processing fees in accordance with EITF No.&nbsp;99-19, <i>Reporting Revenue Gross As A Principal Versus Net As
An Agent</i>.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">65</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='65',FILE='C:\fc\9212173371_D11896_1955427\9193-1-fm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:18 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:16.0pt;margin:0in 0in 24.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ALLEGIANT TRAVEL COMPANY<br> NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)<br> For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005 and 2004<br> (Dollars in thousands except share and per share amounts)</font></b></p>


<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Summary of Significant
Accounting Policies (Continued)</p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Concentration of Credit Risk</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Services provided to affiliates of Harrah&#146;s Entertainment
Inc. and Apple Vacations West,&nbsp;Inc. separately did not exceed 10% of the
Company&#146;s consolidated revenue for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006. Services
provided to affiliates of Harrah&#146;s Entertainment Inc. exceeded 10% of the
Company&#146;s consolidated revenue for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005. In
addition, services provided to affiliates of Harrah&#146;s Entertainment Inc. and
Apple Vacations West,&nbsp;Inc. separately exceeded 10% of the Company&#146;s
consolidated revenue for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004. For the years
ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005 and 2004, the Company&#146;s contract
relationships with these third parties accounted for 11%, 19%, and 43% of total
revenues, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Financial Instruments</font></i></b></font><b><i style="font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;&nbsp; </i></b>The Company
accounts for financial instruments under Statement of Financial Accounting
Standards Board (&#147;SFAS&#148;) No.&nbsp;133, <i>Accounting
For Derivative Instruments and Hedging Activities</i>, as amended. Such
instruments consist principally of fuel derivative contracts as described in
Note&nbsp;8.</p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Maintenance and Repair Costs</font></i></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft
maintenance and repair costs.</font></i></font><i>&nbsp;&nbsp; </i>The Company accounts for
maintenance activities under the direct expense method. Under this method,
maintenance and repair costs for owned and leased aircraft, including major
overhaul maintenance costs, are charged to operating expenses as incurred. Maintenance
deposits paid to aircraft lessors in advance of the performance of major
maintenance activities are recorded as prepaid maintenance deposits, and then
recognized as maintenance expense when the underlying maintenance is performed.
These deposits are calculated based on a performance measure, such as flight
hours or cycles, and are available for reimbursement to the Company upon the
completion of the maintenance of the leased aircraft. If there are sufficient
funds on deposit to reimburse the Company for the invoices initially paid by
the Company for these maintenance events, they are reimbursed to the Company by
the lessor. Under most of the Company&#146;s existing aircraft lease agreements, if
the Company exercises the option to purchase the aircraft and there are excess maintenance
deposit balances at the exercise date of the purchase option, any excess
amounts are applied to the purchase price as an additional down payment. If at
any point the Company determines it is not probable it will recover amounts
retained by the lessor through future maintenance events, such amounts are
expensed.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The maintenance deposits paid under the Company&#146;s
lease agreements do not transfer either the obligation to maintain the aircraft
or the cost risk associated with the maintenance activities to the aircraft
lessor. In addition, the Company maintains the right to select any third-party
maintenance provider. Therefore, the amounts paid as deposits are recorded on
the balance sheet and then recognized as maintenance expense when the
underlying maintenance is performed, in accordance with the Company&#146;s
maintenance accounting policy. Maintenance deposits totaled $2.8 million and
$3.2 million as of December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005, respectively. Any amounts
that are not probable of being used to fund future maintenance expense, would
be recognized as additional aircraft lease rentals.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">66</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='66',FILE='C:\fc\9212173371_D11896_1955427\9193-1-fm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:18 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:16.0pt;margin:0in 0in 24.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ALLEGIANT TRAVEL COMPANY<br> NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)<br> For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005 and 2004<br> (Dollars in thousands except share and per share amounts)</font></b></p>


<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Summary of Significant
Accounting Policies (Continued)</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In determining whether it is probable maintenance
deposits will be used to fund the cost of maintenance events, the Company
conducts the following analysis:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>At the time of
delivery of each aircraft under lease, the Company evaluates the aircraft&#146;s
condition, including the airframe, the engines, the auxiliary power unit and
the landing gear.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The Company projects
future usage of the aircraft during the term of the lease based on its business
and fleet plan.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The Company
estimates the cost of performing all required maintenance during the lease
term. These estimates are based on the extensive experience of the Company&#146;s
management and industry available data, including historical fleet operating statistic
reports published by the Company&#146;s engine manufacturer, Pratt&nbsp;&amp;
Whitney.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has determined it is probable that all but
an immaterial amount of the maintenance deposits would be used to pay the
expected costs of maintenance events during the term of the aircraft leases.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company reviews this
asset (the maintenance deposits) for potential impairment in the preparation of
its financial statements. Because there have been no material changes to the
estimated cost of expected maintenance events during the remaining term of the
leases, no impairment charge was recognized for the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2006, 2005 or 2004.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Advertising Costs</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Advertising costs are
charged to expense in the period incurred. Advertising expense was $3,426,
$1,893 and $1,096 for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005 and 2004,
respectively.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">67</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='67',FILE='C:\fc\9212173371_D11896_1955427\9193-1-fm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:18 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:16.0pt;margin:0in 0in 24.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ALLEGIANT TRAVEL COMPANY<br> NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)<br> For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005 and 2004<br> (Dollars in thousands except share and per share amounts)</font></b></p>


<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Summary of Significant
Accounting Policies (Continued)</p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Earnings per Share</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table sets forth the computation of net income per share, on a basic
and diluted basis:</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="358" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:268.25pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="231" colspan="8" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:173.5pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Year&nbsp;Ended&nbsp;December&nbsp;31,</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:1.7pt;">

</div>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
dilutive effect of common stock subject to outstanding options and warrants to
purchase shares of common stock was not material.</p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stock-Based Compensation</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Effective January&nbsp;1, 2006, the Company adopted
the provisions of SFAS No.&nbsp;123(R), <i>Share-Based
Payments</i>, requiring the compensation cost relating to share-based
payment transactions be recognized in the statement of operations. The cost is
measured at the grant date, based on the calculated fair value of the award
using the Black-Scholes option pricing model, and is recognized as an expense
over the employee&#146;s requisite service period (the vesting period of the equity
award). The Company adopted SFAS 123(R)&nbsp;using the modified prospective
method and accordingly, financial statement amounts for the prior periods have
not been restated to reflect the fair value method of recognizing compensation
cost relating to stock options issued in 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 6.0pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Prior to January&nbsp;1,
2006, the Company accounted for share-based compensation to employees in
accordance with Accounting Principles Board (&#147;APB&#148;) Opinion No.&nbsp;25, <i>Accounting for Stock Issued to Employees</i>,
and related interpretations in accounting for stock options. As such,
compensation expense was recorded on the date of grant only if the current
market price of the underlying stock exceeded the exercise price. No
compensation cost has been recognized for stock option grants to employees in
the accompanying consolidated financial statements for periods prior to January&nbsp;1,
2006, as all options granted had an exercise price equal to or above the market
value of the underlying common stock on the date of grant.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">68</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='68',FILE='C:\fc\9212173371_D11896_1955427\9193-1-fm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:18 2007' -->

options are as follows:</font></p>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in 9.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2006, the Company recorded $385 of compensation expense in
the Statements of Income related to stock options and restricted stock. As of December&nbsp;31,
2006, there was approximately $2,338 of total unrecognized compensation cost
related to nonvested share-based compensation arrangements granted under the
Company&#146;s stock incentive plan.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Accumulated Comprehensive Income</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Comprehensive income is
comprised of changes in the fair value of short-term investments and marketable
securities deemed to be available for sale by management.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Newly Issued Accounting Pronouncements</font></i></b></p>

<p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June&nbsp;2006,
the FASB issued Interpretation No.&nbsp;48, <i>Accounting
for Uncertainty in Income Taxes&#151;An interpretation of FASB Statement No.&nbsp;109</i>,
or FIN 48, which clarifies the accounting and disclosure requirements for
uncertainty in tax positions, as defined. Under FIN 48, a tax position must be
at least more-likely-than-not to be sustained, based solely on its technical
merits, upon examination by the relevant taxing authority before a benefit is
recognized in the financial statements. FIN 48 also provides guidance on
derecognition, measurement, classification, interest and penalties, accounting
in interim periods, disclosure and transition. This interpretation is effective
for fiscal years beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2006. The Company does not
expect the interpretation will have a material impact on its results from
operations or financial position.</font></p>

<p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September&nbsp;2006,
the FASB issued SFAS No.&nbsp;157, <i>Fair
Value Measurements, </i>or SFAS 157, which clarifies the definition of
fair value, establishes guidelines for measuring fair value, and expands
disclosures regarding fair value measurements. SFAS 157 does not require any
new fair value measurements and eliminates inconsistencies in guidance found in
various prior accounting pronouncements. SFAS 157 will be effective for the
Company on January&nbsp;1, 2008. The Company is currently evaluating the impact
of adopting SFAS 157 on its financial position, cash flows, and results of
operations.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">69</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='69',FILE='C:\fc\9212173371_D11896_1955427\9193-1-fm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:18 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:16.0pt;margin:0in 0in 24.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ALLEGIANT TRAVEL COMPANY<br> NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)<br> For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005 and 2004<br> (Dollars in thousands except share and per share amounts)</font></b></p>


<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Summary of Significant Accounting Policies (Continued)</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September&nbsp;2006,
the Securities and Exchange Commission (&#147;SEC&#148;) released Staff Accounting
Bulletin No.&nbsp;108, <i>Considering the
Effects of Prior Year Misstatements when Quantifying Misstatements in Current
Year Financial Statements,</i> or SAB 108. SAB 108 provides interpretive
guidance on the SEC&#146;s views on how the effects of the carryover or reversal of
prior year misstatements should be considered in quantifying a current year
misstatement. The provisions of SAB 108 are effective for the Company for the
fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006. The adoption of SAB 108 has not to
date had a material effect on its financial position, cash flows, or results of
operations.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.&nbsp;&nbsp; Property
and Equipment<a name="a2_PropertyAndEquipment_174830"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At December&nbsp;31, 2006, the Company&#146;s fleet
consisted of 26 MD80 series aircraft, 24 of which were in revenue service. The
Company owns 17 of these aircraft while five are subject to capital leases and
four are subject to operating lease agreements. As of December&nbsp;31, 2005,
the Company&#146;s fleet consisted of 22 MD80 series aircraft, 17 of which were in
revenue service.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">70</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

 <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:16.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 24.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ALLEGIANT TRAVEL COMPANY<br> NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)<br> For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005 and 2004<br> (Dollars in thousands except share and per share amounts)</font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Property
and Equipment (Continued)</p>

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Depreciation and
amortization expense for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005 and 2004
was $10,584, $5,088 and $2,183, respectively. </font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Accrued
Liabilities</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Accrued
liabilities consist of the following:</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="383" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:287.3pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="100" colspan="5" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:75.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">As&nbsp;of&nbsp;December&nbsp;31,</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="383" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:287.3pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="45" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">2006</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">71</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='71',FILE='C:\fc\921218352_D11896_1955427\9193-1-fo.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:19 2007' -->

 <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:16.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 24.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ALLEGIANT TRAVEL COMPANY<br> NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)<br> For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005 and 2004<br> (Dollars in thousands except share and per share amounts)</font></b></p>


<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Long-Term
Debt</p>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Maturities of long-term
debt and capital lease obligations, as of December&nbsp;31, 2006, for the next
five years and thereafter, in aggregate, are: 2007&#151;$14,888; 2008&#151;$14,158; 2009&#151;$16,781;
2010&#151;$14,304; 2011&#151;$12,634 and none thereafter. </font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Capital
and Operating Lease Obligations </p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Capital Leases</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has entered
into five lease agreements for aircraft which are classified as capital leases
under the provisions of SFAS No.&nbsp;13, <i>Accounting
For Leases</i>. The capital lease agreements are typically for a term of
five years and the present value of the minimum lease payments exceed the fair
market value of the aircraft at the inception of the lease. The carrying value
of aircraft under capital lease arrangements included in property and equipment
totaled $26,136 and $28,471 as of December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005,
respectively. Amortization of aircraft under capital lease arrangements is
included in depreciation and amortization expense. </font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating Leases</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31, 2006, the Company has entered
into operating lease agreements for four aircraft with terms extending through July&nbsp;2008.
Two of these lease agreements include renewal options for a period of not less
than 18 months. Because the lease renewals are not considered to be reasonably
assured as defined in SFAS No.&nbsp;13, the rental payments that would be due
during the renewal periods are not included in the determination of rent
expense until the leases are renewed. During 2006, the Company exercised the
purchase options included in lease agreements on six aircraft. Purchase options
are included in the remaining lease agreements on all but two of the leased
aircraft. Additionally, the Company leases </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">72</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='72',FILE='C:\fc\921218352_D11896_1955427\9193-1-fo.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:19 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:16.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 24.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ALLEGIANT TRAVEL COMPANY<br> NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)<br> For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005 and 2004<br> (Dollars in thousands except share and per share amounts)</font></b></p>


<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Capital and Operating Lease Obligations (Continued)</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">office facilities, airport
and terminal facilities and office equipment under operating lease arrangements
with terms extending through 2014. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Airport and terminal facility leases are entered into
with a variety of local governments and other third parties. These lease
arrangements have a variety of terms and conditions. Leasehold improvements
made at these facilities are not material. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total rental expense charged to operations for
aircraft and non-aircraft operating leases for the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2006, 2005 and 2004 was $7,885, $6,627 and $5,015, respectively. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At December&nbsp;31,
2006, scheduled future minimum lease payments under operating leases with
initial or remaining non&#173;cancelable lease terms in excess of one year and
amounts due under capital lease arrangements are as follows: </font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">

 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="372" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:278.8pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Long-term obligations</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="39" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">21,140</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.9pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="39" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.9pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Income
Taxes </p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Prior to May&nbsp;2004, the Company elected to be
taxed under the provisions of Subchapter S of the Internal Revenue Code wherein
the taxable income or loss of the Company was included in the income tax
returns of the shareholders. In May&nbsp;2004, the Company reorganized as a
limited liability company and was therefore taxed as a partnership for federal
income tax purposes until the reorganization into a corporation effected at the
time of the Company&#146;s initial public offering. Because the Company did not pay
corporate federal income tax at the entity level on its taxable income, no
provision for federal income taxes is reflected in the accompanying financial
statements for these periods. A provision for state income taxes has been
included in the financial statements for each of the three years ended December&nbsp;31,
2006, 2005 and 2004, respectively, as the Company was also subject to tax at
the entity level in certain states in which it operates. Deferred income taxes
for such states are not material. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Had the Company been taxed as a corporation prior to
its initial public offering in December&nbsp;2006, on a pro-forma basis, its tax
provision would have been $1,975 and $0 for the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2006 and 2005, respectively.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">73</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='73',FILE='C:\fc\921218352_D11896_1955427\9193-1-fo.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:19 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:16.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 24.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ALLEGIANT TRAVEL COMPANY<br> NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)<br> For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005 and 2004<br> (Dollars in thousands except share and per share amounts)</font></b></p>


<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Income Taxes (Continued)</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">After the reorganization, the Company accounts for
taxes in accordance with Statement of Financial Accounting Standard No.&nbsp;109,
<i>Accounting for Income Taxes</i> (&#147;SFAS 109&#148;)
which requires the recognition of tax benefits or expense on the temporary
differences between the financial reporting and tax bases of its assets and
liabilities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
components of the provision (benefit) for income taxes are as follows:</font></p>

  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.5pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="39" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(108</font></p>

 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">74</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='74',FILE='C:\fc\921218352_D11896_1955427\9193-1-fo.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:19 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:16.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 24.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ALLEGIANT TRAVEL COMPANY<br> NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)<br> For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005 and 2004<br> (Dollars in thousands except share and per share amounts)</font></b></p>


<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Income Taxes (Continued)</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The major affected
components of the Company&#146;s net deferred tax assets are as follows:</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="244" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:183.15pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="109" colspan="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:81.55pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">C-Corporation<br>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company paid LLC state
income taxes, net of refunds of $63 in 2006.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Related
Party Transactions</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The facility which houses the Company&#146;s Las Vegas,
Nevada corporate headquarters was owned through April&nbsp;2005 by an entity in
which the Company&#146;s Chief Executive Officer and another Director are
principals. Rent expense paid to the related party for the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2006, 2005 and 2004, was $0, $117 and $333, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company utilizes software developed and maintained
by a corporation owned by the Company&#146;s founder and former Chief Executive
Officer and Chairman of the Board. System development and maintenance expenses
for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005 and 2004 totaled $490, $285
and $190, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company periodically utilizes private aircraft
owned by a corporation principally owned by the Company&#146;s Chief Executive
Officer and another Director for the time-sensitive delivery of aircraft parts
and other critical travel situations. For the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2006, 2005 and 2004 these expenses totaled $81, $0 and $66, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For administrative reasons, the Company arranged for
the payment of salaries and benefits for executive officers and other
management bonuses through Flynn Gallagher Associates, of which the Chief
Executive Officer and another Director are owners and principals. The Company
reimbursed Flynn </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">75</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='75',FILE='C:\fc\921218352_D11896_1955427\9193-1-fo.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:19 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:16.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 24.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ALLEGIANT TRAVEL COMPANY<br> NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)<br> For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005 and 2004<br> (Dollars in thousands except share and per share amounts)</font></b></p>


<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Related Party Transactions (Continued)</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Gallagher
Associates for the actual cost paid by it for the benefit of these employees. During
2006, the total amount paid by the Company under this arrangement was
approximately $793. This arrangement for salaries and benefits for these
executive officers has now been discontinued.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company had notes
payable to its Chief Executive Officer totaling $891 and $1,735 as of December
31, 2006 and 2005, respectively. (See Note 4.) </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 9.5pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June 2006, the Company
purchased an MD83 aircraft from an entity in which the Chief Executive Officer
and another Director are principals. The purchase price of $3,525 was paid
directly to a secured lender, and none of the proceeds were paid to the entity
with which the Company&#146;s Chief Executive Officer and Director are principals. </font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Financial
Instruments and Risk Management <a name="a8_FinancialInstrumentsAndRiskMan_164830"></a></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fuel Price Risk
Management </font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Airline operations are
inherently dependent upon energy to operate and, therefore, are impacted by
changes in jet fuel prices. Aircraft fuel expense represented approximately
46.0%, 42.4%, and 33.1% of the Company&#146;s operating expenses for the years ended
December 31, 2006, 2005 and 2004, respectively. The Company endeavors to
acquire jet fuel at the lowest possible cost. Because jet fuel is not traded on
an organized futures exchange, liquidity for hedging is limited. However, the
Company has found commodities for effective hedging of jet fuel costs,
primarily crude oil, and refined products such as heating oil and unleaded
gasoline. The Company utilizes financial derivative instruments as economic
hedges to decrease its exposure to jet fuel price increases. The Company does
not purchase or hold any derivative financial instruments for trading purposes.
</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s derivatives
have historically not qualified as hedges for financial reporting purposes in
accordance with SFAS No. 133, <i>Accounting for
Derivative Instruments and Hedging Activities</i>. Accordingly, changes
in the fair value of such derivative contracts, which amounted to a loss of $4,193
and gains of $612 and $4,438 in years 2006, 2005 and 2004, respectively were
recorded as a &#147;(Gain)/loss on fuel derivatives, net&#148; within Other income
(expense) in the accompanying consolidated statements of operations. The fair
value of hedge contracts amounted to ($1,622) and $20 as of December 31, 2006
and 2005, respectively, and was recorded in &#147;Accrued liabilities&#148; and &#147;Other
current assets&#148; in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 9.5pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December 31, 2006,
the Company had derivative instruments on 10.2% of its projected 2007 fuel
consumption. </font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Debt </font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 9.5pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s debt with a
carrying value of $47,497 and $31,264 as of December 31, 2006 and 2005
respectively, approximates fair value. These fair value estimates were based on
the discounted amount of future cash flows using the Company&#146;s current
incremental rate of borrowing for similar liabilities.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other Financial
Instruments </font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 9.5pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The carrying amounts of
cash, cash equivalents, restricted cash, accounts receivable and accounts
payable approximate fair value due to their short term nature. </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">76</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='76',FILE='C:\fc\921218352_D11896_1955427\9193-1-fo.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:19 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>
 <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:16.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 24.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ALLEGIANT TRAVEL COMPANY<br> NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)<br> For the years ended December 31, 2006, 2005 and 2004<br> (Dollars in thousands except share and per share amounts)</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9.&nbsp;&nbsp; Employee Benefit
Plans</font></b></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">401(k) Plan </font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has a defined
contribution plan covering substantially all eligible employees. Under the
Plan, employees may contribute up to 18% of their eligible annual compensation
with the Company matching up to 3% of eligible employee wages. Employees
generally vest in matching contributions ratably over five years. The Company
recognized expense under this plan of $445, $263 and $129 for the years ended
December 31, 2006, 2005 and 2004, respectively. </font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Share Option Program </font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February 2005, the Company adopted a share option
program (the &#147;Share Option Program&#148;) granting key employees the option to
purchase shares of the Company&#146;s common stock. Under the plan, the Company
reserved an aggregate of 500,000 shares of common stock for issuance pursuant
to the exercise of options. The options are granted at exercise prices that
approximate fair market value as of the grant date. The options vest ratably
over the term specified in the option agreement, typically three years, and
have a contractual life of 10 years. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The fair value of options granted were estimated as of
the grant date using the Black-Scholes option pricing model with the following
assumptions for 2005: no dividend yield; an expected life of 6 years; risk-free
interest rates of 3.83%; and volatility of 60.3%. No options were granted or
outstanding in 2004. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
April 2006, Allegiant Travel Company&#146;s Board of Directors adopted, and the
stockholders approved, a Long-Term Incentive Plan (the &#147;2006 Plan&#148;). Upon the merger
of Allegiant Travel Company, LLC into Allegiant Travel Company (a Nevada
corporation) immediately prior to the Company&#146;s initial public offering, all
outstanding options under the Share Option Program were transferred to the 2006
Plan and no further option grants will be made under the Share Option Program.
The transferred options will continue to be governed by their existing terms,
unless the Company&#146;s compensation committee elects to extend one or more
features of the 2006 Plan to those options. The Company has reserved 3,000,000
shares of common stock for issuance under the 2006 Plan. Such shares include
the 500,000 shares that were transferred from the Share Option Program.</font></p>

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  <td width="310" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:232.55pt;">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">127,000</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="32" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.59</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="45" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">77</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='77',FILE='C:\fc\92122025624_D11896_1955427\9193-1-fq.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:21 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:16.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 24.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ALLEGIANT TRAVEL COMPANY<br> NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)<br> For the years ended December 31, 2006, 2005 and 2004<br> (Dollars in thousands except share and per share amounts)</font></b></p>


<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Employee Benefit Plans (Continued)</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The range of exercise
prices for options granted in 2005 was $3.50&#151;$4.50, and the weighted average
fair value of options granted in 2005 was $2.13. The exercise prices of all
options granted in 2006 was $13.00 and the weighted average fair value of
options granted in 2006 was $7.63. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December 2006, the
Company issued 100,000 shares of restricted stock under the 2006 Long-Term
Incentive Plan which have been allocated as of the date of the initial public
offering among employees at the manager level and below. </font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10.&nbsp;&nbsp; Shareholders&#146;/Members&#146;
Equity</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In August 2003, the
Company approved agreements with several key members of management to sell to
the officers a total of 1,750,000 shares of stock. The Company retained the
right to repurchase these shares in the event of termination of employment for
any reason and agreed to finance the purchase price of the shares purchased at
$.10 per share over a period of three years. In August 2004, one of these
individuals left the Company at which time the Company repurchased 66,667 shares.&#160; These notes were paid in full during 2005.&#160; </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In May 2004, the Company
merged Allegiant Air, Inc. into Allegiant Air LLC (see Note 1). As a result of
this merger, all shares of Allegiant Air, Inc.&#146;s no par value common stock were
converted into $.001 par value shares of Allegiant Air LLC. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During May 2005, the
Members of Allegiant Air LLC transferred and assigned all 6,683,333 outstanding
shares of Allegiant Air LLC to Allegiant Travel Company LLC, in exchange for
6,683,333 newly issued common shares of Allegiant Travel Company LLC. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June 2005, the Company
repurchased 250,000 common shares from three key members of management and the
Company&#146;s founder for a total of $1.0 million, or $4.00 per share. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December 2006, the
Company completed its initial public offering of common stock.&#160; 5,750,000 shares were issued at $18.00 per
share resulting in net proceeds of approximately $94.5 million.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">11.&nbsp;&nbsp; Redeemable
Convertible Preferred Shares </font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In May 2005, the Company
authorized the issuance of up to 9,885,000 shares of redeemable convertible
preferred shares of which 8,635,000 were designated as Series A Convertible
Preferred Shares and 1,250,000 were designated as Series B Convertible
Preferred Shares (the &#147;Preferred Shares&#148;). In May 2005, the Company completed a
private placement offering in which all authorized Series A shares were issued
at $4.00 per share for total proceeds to the Company of $34,540. Concurrently,
all authorized Series&nbsp;B Convertible Preferred Shares were issued at $4.00
per share to the Company&#146;s Chief Executive Officer in exchange for the
cancellation of $5,000 in outstanding debt. Expenses of the offering totaled
$1,360. In connection with the issuance of the Series A Convertible Preferred
Shares, the placement agent was issued 162,500 warrants to acquire the
Company&#146;s common shares at $4.40 per share as part of the consideration for
services provided. The warrants are exercisable through May 5, 2010. The share
purchase warrant agreement includes anti-dilution provisions and piggyback registration
rights in the event of a primary or secondary registration of any class of
securities as defined. The warrants were valued at </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">78</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='78',FILE='C:\fc\92122025624_D11896_1955427\9193-1-fq.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:21 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:16.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 24.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ALLEGIANT TRAVEL COMPANY<br> NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)<br> For the years ended December 31, 2006, 2005 and 2004<br> (Dollars in thousands except share and per share amounts)</font></b></p>


<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">11.</font></b><font face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Redeemable Convertible Preferred Shares (Continued)</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">approximately $329 at the
date of grant using the Black-Scholes valuation method based on the following
assumptions: no dividend yield; an expected life of 5 years; risk-free interest
rate of 3.93%; and volatility of 60%. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Series A and Series B
Convertible Preferred Shares had no stated dividend rate, had voting rights similar
to common shares and could be converted into common shares at any time, at the
option of the holder. Upon the consummation of the Company&#146;s initial public
offering, the outstanding Series A and Series B Convertible Preferred Shares were
automatically converted into common shares on a 0.76 to 1 basis. &#160;The Series A and Series B Convertible
Preferred Shares had redemption rights which were to have become effective in
May 2010. The redemption value was the greater of the Liquidation Value
(defined as $4.00 per share) or the Redemption Value (defined as the market
value of the shares as agreed upon between the Company and the holders of the
Convertible Preferred Shares at the time of redemption). Because of this
redemption feature and other rights associated with the Convertible Preferred
Shares, the Company classified the Convertible Preferred Shares in the
mezzanine section of the accompanying 2005 consolidated balance sheet.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12.&nbsp;&nbsp; Quarterly
Financial Data (Unaudited)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Quarterly results of operations for the years ended
December 31, 2006 and 2005 are summarized below.</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The sum of the quarterly
earnings per share amounts does not equal the annual amount reported since per
share amounts are computed independently for each quarter and for the full year
based on respective weighted-average common shares outstanding and other
dilutive potential common shares.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">79</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='79',FILE='C:\fc\92122025624_D11896_1955427\9193-1-fq.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 12:21 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:16.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 24.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ALLEGIANT TRAVEL COMPANY<br> NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)<br> For the years ended December 31, 2006, 2005 and 2004<br> (Dollars in thousands except share and per share amounts)</font></b></p>


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13.&nbsp;&nbsp; Commitments and
Contingencies </font></b></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Legal Matters </font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company is subject to
certain legal and administrative actions which management considers routine to
its business activities. Management believes after consultation with legal
counsel, the ultimate outcome of any pending legal matters will not have a
material adverse impact on the Company&#146;s financial position, liquidity or
results of operations. </font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">14.&nbsp;&nbsp; Subsequent
Events </font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January 2007, the Company purchased two aircraft
previously under operating leases.&#160; The
purchase price was paid in cash. </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">80</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">
